author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Francesca Orienti muore a 43 anni due giorni dopo l’incidente
text:
Francesca Orienti morta a 43 anni dopo il malore e l’incidente sulla tangenziale
Per approfondire: Articolo: Schianto contro un palo, grave una donna Articolo: Auto slitta, esce di strada e resta in bilico sulla riva del canale Sassuolo, 20 dicembre 2024 – Sorridente, allegra, generosa e sempre disponibile. È il ritratto di Francesca Orienti , la donna di 43 anni di Sassuolo, morta ieri mattina all’ospedale di Baggiovara , dopo essere stata vittima di un malore e di un successivo e conseguente incidente stradale avvenuto nella mattina di mercoledì. Le condizioni della donna erano apparse da subito molto gravi : i medici hanno fatto il possibile per salvarla, ma Francesca non ce l’ha fatta. Tutti, dai familiari agli amici, dai colleghi di lavoro ai compagni di sport, utilizzano le stesse parole per descrivere Francesca: una persona piena di vita.
“La mamma era sempre sorridente e disponibile per gli altri", la ricorda il figlio 17enne Alessandro . Francesca e la famiglia Orienti sono molto conosciuti a Sassuolo e Modena . La donna era dottore commercialista e revisore dei conti, collaboratrice dello ‘Studio Commercialisti Modena’, di cui è socio il padre Eugenio , e rivestiva incarichi di rilievo in varie aziende del territorio, dalla Florim ad Aimag, a Kronos, e ha collaborato anche come supporto al padre nel gruppo Cremonini.
“Lavorava con papà, era il suo sostegno – racconta la sorella Angela, titolare di ‘Angelina Concept Store’ -. Era il sostegno per tutti in realtà, per mamma Giuseppina, per me, lei sempre presente , disponibile, un vero e proprio concentrato di energia positiva, di allegria, di risate, ha vissuto appieno la sua vita facendo quello che più amava , circondata dall’affetto che lei sapeva attirare per la sua grande bontà".
Francesca era generosa e lo è stato fino all’ultimo: lei stessa aveva acconsentito alla donazione degli organi in caso di incidente. Nella giornata di ieri i medici hanno provveduto agli espianti e già nella serata almeno cinque suoi organi sono stati trapiantati ad altrettanti pazienti. «In questo dolore immenso che stiamo vivendo – prosegue lo zio, l’avvocato Corrado Orienti – la sola ‘consolazione’ è il sapere che grazie al suo altruismo altre persone potranno vivere".
Tra le tante passioni di Francesca c’era anche lo sport: un vero talento nel tennis, nello sci e nel padel , "disputava tante gare e vinceva sempre», commenta la sorella. Anche gli ‘amici dello Sporting Club’ di Sassuolo ne piangono la morte: «A livello sportivo era nata nel nostro circolo e partecipava ad ogni tipo di torneo . Era vita allo stato puro”.
“Trasmetteva gioia e calore a chiunque le stesse vicino», aggiunge Maurizio Macca, che da 15 anni lavorava con Francesca nello ‘Studio Commercialisti Modena’.
Stasera alle 18.30 verrà recitato il rosario chiesa di San Giorgio a Sassuolo dove domani alle 9.30 saranno celebrate le esequie.

author: razon.online@razon.com.mx (La Razón Online)
title: Alejandro Armenta afirma que rescatará el Centro Estatal de Estudios Municipales
text: Para fortalecer el respeto a la ley Alejandro Armenta afirma que rescatará el Centro Estatal de Estudios Municipales El gobernador electo de Puebla, Alejandro Armenta, subrayó la importancia de la necesidad de que los servidores públicos comprendan plenamente sus obligaciones, funciones y responsabilidades Con el objetivo de que todas las autoridades municipales basen sus actos en el respeto a la ley y al marco jurídico, el gobernador electo de Puebla, Alejandro Armenta, subrayó la importancia de la necesidad de que los servidores públicos comprendan plenamente sus obligaciones, funciones y responsabilidades. Todo esto, en el marco del proceso de transición bajo los principios de los gobiernos de la llamada Cuarta Transformación. Para ello, se continuarán ofreciendo más capacitaciones, alineadas con la Reforma y la Ley Orgánica de la Administración Pública, que próximamente será enviada al Congreso del Estado de Puebla. Además, se rescatará el Centro Estatal de Estudios Municipales, una institución que en el pasado ayudó a orientar a los presidentes municipales en el ejercicio y la interpretación de la ley, "yo fui producto de este centro, que me permitió hacer mi servicio social y contribuir al conocimiento de la administración pública", señaló Armenta. El gobernador electo de Puebla enfatizó que la dirección general de gobierno y otras áreas deben ser conciliadoras y orientadoras desde el inicio del ejercicio de funciones municipales, para prevenir problemas futuros. Asimismo, recalcó la responsabilidad de los partidos políticos de proporcionar capacitación continua a sus autoridades para un buen gobierno, asegurando que su administración hará lo propio con los presidentes y presidentas municipales a través del partido. "Queremos evitar prácticas indebidas en los ayuntamientos y en el gobierno del Estado. Por ello, estaremos muy pendientes y vigilantes, asegurándonos de que la capacitación esté orientada al respeto a la ley", concluyó Armenta. Estas acciones buscan profesionalizar a los próximos servidores públicos, para garantizar una gestión transparente y por Amor a Puebla. author: Nitish Verma
title: U.S. Navy Neutralizes 15 Houthi UAVs in Red Sea, Safeguarding Global Shipping Lanes
text:
Early Saturday, U.S. Navy ships and aircraft intercepted and destroyed 15 uncrewed aerial vehicles (UAVs) launched by Yemen's Houthi forces into the strategic waters of the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, marking a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict in the region. Central Command (CENTCOM) identified these UAVs as posing an imminent threat to commercial and military maritime traffic, highlighting the operation's importance in maintaining the safety of one of the world's busiest shipping lanes.
The Rising Threat in the Red Sea
The assault, which took place between 4 a.m. and 6:30 a.m. (1300-1530 GMT), was characterized by CENTCOM as a large-scale attack by "Iranian-backed Houthi
terrorists." This aggressive action underscores the Houthis' increasing capability and willingness to target international maritime routes, posing a direct threat to global commerce and regional stability. Recent incidents, as reported by various security analysts, have shown that Houthi rebel drone attacks in the Red Sea and Suez Canal route have not only endangered vessels but also exposed significant vulnerabilities in conventional ship alert systems.
International Reaction and the Need for Advanced Defenses
The international community, including the EU and the UK, has condemned the Houthi's provocative actions, stressing the importance of keeping these crucial maritime corridors open and secure. The recent attacks have led to heightened security measures, including the rerouting of ships, increased insurance costs, and potential rises in global food prices due to the disruption of trade routes. Experts argue that traditional radar systems are inadequate against such UAV threats, advocating for the adoption of AI-driven technologies for early detection and defense against these increasingly sophisticated aerial attacks.
Implications for Global Trade and Security
The successful interception of Houthi UAVs by the U.S. Navy not only prevented potential damage to merchant vessels and coalition ships but also highlighted the critical role of technological advancement and international cooperation in combating non-state actors' threats. This incident serves as a stark reminder of the fragile security situation in key maritime passages and its impact on global trade. With the Houthis threatening further attacks, ensuring the safety of these waterways remains a paramount concern for the international community, requiring a concerted effort to bolster defenses and deter future aggressions.
As the world watches closely, the events unfolding in the Red Sea underscore the intricate balance between regional conflicts and global economic stability. The proactive measures taken by the U.S. Navy and its allies in neutralizing the immediate threat represent a significant step towards safeguarding international shipping lanes, but the long-term solution lies in addressing the underlying political and security challenges in Yemen and the broader region. The ongoing conflict, if left unchecked, threatens not only the lives of seafarers but also the economic well-being of nations reliant on these critical sea routes for their supplies and trade.

author: Paul Blume
title: Ricky Cobb shooting: Prosecutors will seek aggravated sentence if Ryan Londregan is convicted
text:
MINNEAPOLIS (FOX 9) - The Hennepin County Attorney's Office has signaled its intention to seek an aggravated sentence for Minnesota State Trooper Ryan Londregan if he is convicted in the deadly traffic stop shooting of Ricky Cobb II in July 2023.
Londregan is currently charged with second-degree unintentional murder, second-degree manslaughter and first-degree assault. He made his first court appearance on the charges earlier this week.
READ MORE: Ricky Cobb shooting: Grand jury process explained as defense seeks dismissal In a new court filing, the prosecutors say if there is a conviction, they want Londregan doing additional prison time. Prosecutors also told the court they intend to prove Londregan committed additional offenses on other occasions, but court filings do not elaborate further.
Londregan shot and killed Cobb during a traffic stop on Interstate 94 in Minneapolis on July 31, 2023.
A spokesperson for the office tells FOX 9 it is a preliminary filing and is not necessarily indicative of how the case will play out.
Londregan, who was on the job as a state trooper for about a year and a half at the time, is currently free on a set of court-mandated conditions, including that he remains law-abiding, surrenders his passport and has no contact with Cobb's family or potential witnesses in the case.
Londregan's next court appearance is scheduled for April 29.

author: FIRST ALERT WEATHER
title: chevron-right
text: THURSDAY, APRIL 18, 2024 THIS EVENING: Partly Cloudy Temperatures : 70s to 60s Winds : Northeast 5-10 mph Clouds will stick around this evening as temperatures fall through the 70s and 60s. TONIGHT: Increasing Clouds Lows: 45-52 Winds: East 5-10 mph Dry weather is expected overnight, but clouds will increase. It will also be cooler overnight with many neighborhoods dipping into the 40s. FRIDAY: Mostly Cloudy, Showers Lows: 65-70 Winds: Southeast 5-10 mph We'll round out the week with clouds and cooler afternoon highs in the upper 60s (seasonable for mid-April). There's a slight chance for a few, passing showers throughout the day, as a cold front approaches, but there is not a lot of moisture associated with this weather-maker. Those who get rain will only see a few hundredths of a inch. SATURDAY: Partly Cloudy, Breezy Highs: 68-73 Winds: Northwest 10-15 mph, Gusts 20 to 30 mph Saturday, Earth Day, will be the warmer weekend day with highs around 70 degrees. It will be a breezy day with low humidity and a mix of sun and clouds for any of your outdoor plans. SUNDAY: Partly Cloudy Highs: 58-63 Winds: Northwest 5-10 mph Cooler than average temperatures will round out the weekend. Sunday morning will start off in the 40s, so it will be a noticeably cooler/colder to start the day. Afternoon highs will only reach the low 60s, which is below average. Sunday will be the first time in a week and a half with below average temperatures, so make sure to have a light jacket for your Sunday plans, especially in the morning. Download the First Alert Weather app to stay up to date with the latest forecast. ","forecast":
